website_summaries.verdict: The Brooks Cascadia 13 was mostly well-received by trail running enthusiasts. They apparently liked its versatile outsole unit, stating that the roads weren’t a problem. The cushioning unit, the rubber exterior, and the fabrics on the upper were also given praise. Overall, this trail running shoe for neutral runners proved to be a worthy update to the series.
pros: The traction capability of the Brooks Cascadia 13 was lauded by many of those who have tested it
The availability of a wide-width version was welcomed by those who had broad foot-dimensions
Some consumers welcomed the airflow granted by the upper unit
The underfoot cushioning system was deemed comfortable and easy on the muscles of the legs
Some runners liked that the outsole wasn’t too aggressive
they were able to tackle the roads with ease
There were no blisters and hot spots while wearing the Cascadia 13, according to several purchasers
cons: The eyelets ripped apart after several uses, a tester claimed

customer_reviews.title: Next evolution of a great trainer.
customer_reviews.text: The Cascadia 12 has been the best all purpose trainer I've had. It's hard wearing and provides the right amount of support for day to day activities on my feet as well as on a run. At first the Cascadia 13 felt a little clunky to get used to but having bought my second pair I can see that Brooks have just evolved the shoe enough to stay true to its roots without going crazy. I hope they do the same with the 14!
customer_reviews.author: James D

customer_reviews.title: Gave me an injury
customer_reviews.text: These could be good, but I developed a knee injury after 2 weeks that went away one week after I got a pair of asics
customer_reviews.author: Chrism

customer_reviews.title: My first trail shoes after years of just road running ...
customer_reviews.text: My first trail shoes after years of just road running then using road shoes off road These were transformational - so stable and absorb so much from uneven ground Only wish I’d bought them sooner
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fitwell and are comfortable.
customer_reviews.text: Comfortable have run 12 miles in hot weather and no blisters, breathable uppers. Flexible mid sole, ok on all surfaces, the soles grip well.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Peter A. Fitzpatrick

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes
customer_reviews.text: Very good for trail running. The colours and the shoes overall are beautiful. The fit is quite larger than expected, would recommend buying 0.5cm smaller than usual.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: 3D print mud and stone barrier very good, even through light water.
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable and stable on rough trails, Shoelace pocket very helpful, weight of shoes are not an issue
customer_reviews.author: Derek Corcoran

customer_reviews.title: Excellent trail shied
customer_reviews.text: So comfy, so practical, Brooks trainers suit me perfectly and I’ve tried others. These Cascadia 13 are just great, for me.
customer_reviews.author: MJ HENDERSON

customer_reviews.title: A Great All Rounder
customer_reviews.text: Thoroughly recommend these to anyone looking for their first off-road, trail running trainers. If you are unsure of what you want in a shoe, these are generally strong in every area. They are light but sturdy. They provide good protection from rocks and the elements but it feels like you are wearing slippers. I bought my normal size shoe and have broad feet... but there is plenty of room. Then there is the sole, which grips the terrain like a formula one car. I've run through forests, riverbeds and scree but always had the confidence that I wouldn't slip or lose my footing.
customer_reviews.author: haitch

customer_reviews.title: Longer than my last Brooks so bare that in mind, no complaints yet though.
customer_reviews.text: I usually take a UK 10.5 in Brooks (Adrenaline ASR's which included the half a size up for running shoes) so purchased the same in these but had to exchange for a 10 so be warned they come up larger than some other Brooks. Side by side the Cascadia 13's in 10 are the same size as my ASR's in a 10.5. I can't comment on the run as I'm a failed runner right now due to my knee and currently wearing them for commuting. Very comfortable and light though.
customer_reviews.author: Herb Asher

customer_reviews.title: Slippery when Wet
customer_reviews.text: The positive is that these trail shoes are perhaps the most comfortable I've worn. Unfortunately they are also treacherous on wet rock, so totally unsuitable for fell running where there's a chance of a light shower or having to run through a stream. If you're trail running in Death Valley I'm sure they're wonderful. The Yorkshire Dales or Lake District I'd forget it!
customer_reviews.author: Richard

product_meta.title: Brooks Men's Cascadia 13 Cross Trainers
product_meta.description: Real running adventures begin with the most versatile shoe. Renowned because of its winning combination of protective cushioning, versatile traction and adaptable fit, this version presents an advanced rotation system that improves general cushioning and flexibility during removing the tip and works to create a suspension system that ensures high stability. The absorbing midsole in BioMoGo DNA, adapts dynamically to every stride and stride. The segmented Crash Pad, characterized by special padding located between the midsole and the internal sole. The upper in the GORE-TEX version guarantees breathability and better manages the humidity, keeping feet cool and dry, instead the Pivot Post technology engages ensuring a stabilizing suspension system.
feature_bullets: Internal saddle system for a close-to-foot fit
Ariaprene tongue for comfort and breathability
3D Rubber Print Mud Guard to protect against trail debris
